body: AN exterior elevator shaft with a glass- paneled cab is under construction in the Kensington section of Brooklyn as part of the renovation of a four-story walk-up at 5l0 Ocean Parkway into cooperative apartments. Passengers will be able to look through the glass paneling across the building's open front court to the street. The concept is derived
title: PERSPECTIVES: HOUSING DESIGN; OUTSIDE ELEVATORS MAY HELP SELL RENOVATED WALK-UPS

body: Charles Joseph Mylod, a lawyer and real-estate executive who was instrumental in the development of several major office buildings in Manhattan, including Lever House at 390 Park Avenue, died Thursday at his home in the Park Slope section of Brooklyn. He was 81 years old. A major part of Mr. Mylod's realestate career was spent with Goelet Real
title: Charles J. Mylod, 81, Of Goelet Real Estate

body: Charles J. Mylod, a real-estate executive in New York for more than half a century, died of a heart attack Thursday at his home in Brooklyn. He was 81 years old. Mr. Mylod was president of the Goelet Realty Company, which managed many properties in the city that stemmed from the estate of an old New York family. Mr. Mylod, a 1925 graduate of
title: Charles J. Mylod, 81, Of Goelet Realty Co.

body: IT has long been the conventional wisdom that families with children who cannot afford housing in Manhattan's choice neighborhoods have no alternative but to move to the the suburbs. body: Following is a breakdown, by region, of the projects to be paid for by the $1.25 billion ''Rebuild New York'' bond issue if it is approved by voters in November. body: An unusual coalition of Democratic elected officials is trying to defeat one of the early proponents of school decentralization in a bitter school board contest in Brooklyn. title: POLITICAL CHARGES TRADED IN SCHOOL ELECTION FIGHT
